com.ibm.team.scm.client

Interface IChangeHistory


  • public interface IChangeHistory
    Represents a history of the changes made across all versionable items within a component's change history. IChangeHistory's are accessible through a workspace or a baseline.

    Change histories are large objects that live server-side in the repository. Histories are normally broken up into eras. Each change history is comprised of a set of change sets applied in an era, paired with another change history detailing what happened in earlier eras. Thus each change history is really a picture that goes back to the beginning of history of some (root) workspace.

    Like configurations, change histories stay put in the repository. All you ever need an IChangeHistory for is to provide context. Furthermore, there are no operations that overtly change a change history; it always happens indirectly as a result of manipulating a workspace.

    Change histories are intended to be used by multi-threaded clients. Unless noted, the methods on IChangeHistory can be safely called from multiple threads concurrently without risk of corruption.

    Since:
    0.10.0.1 (RTC 5.0.1)

    • Method Detail

      • teamRepository

        ITeamRepository teamRepository()
        Returns the repository associated with this change history. The client need not be logged in to the repository.
        Returns:
        the repository, which is never null

      • getConnection

        IConnection getConnection()
        Returns the connection associated with this change history. The client need not be logged in to the repository.
        Returns:
        the connection, which is never null

      • configuration

        IConfiguration configuration()
        Returns an object that can be used to access the change history's configuration. This configuration is computed by processing all of change history. This configuration may not not fixed if the change history is live.
        Returns:
        the configuration; never null

      • getEraIdentifier

        UUID getEraIdentifier()
        Returns a UUID which uniquely identifies the era which this IChangeHistory represents on the server.
        Returns:
        a UUID, which is never null

      • isLive

        boolean isLive()
        Returns whether this change history is "live". Live histories may change over time, which may affect the results they return for their methods. Fixed histories are constant and do not change their answers over time. Note that the various Collection objects returned by the methods do not change under foot for live change histories; it's just that the collections you get back next time may contain different elements.

        A history that is live at one point may become fixed at some later point. The converse cannot happen: no fixed history ever comes back to life.

        Design note: The live flag allows the client to programmatically discover whether information retrieved from a configuration would be cacheable by the client.

        Implementation note: The live flag can be defaulted to true. The first server round trip, it can be updated to be accurate.

        Returns:
        true if this change history is live, and false if it is fixed

      • getComponent

        IComponentHandle getComponent()
        Returns the component associated with this change history.
        Returns:
        the handle of the component associated with this change history; never null

      • isAvailable

        boolean isAvailable(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
        Returns whether this change history is available.

        A change history may be unavailable for any number of reasons, including:

        • The repository is not logged in to.
        Parameters:
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        true if this change history is available, and false if it is unavailable for any reason
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • recent

        java.util.List recent(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns the list of change sets made in the era of this change history. The change sets are arranged in approximate chronological order (in terms of when they were applied to the object, such as a workspace, which has the change history, rather than by their absolute creation dates). The change sets are intended to be applied in that order to the configuration corresponding to the previous history. This operation fails if this change history is not available.

        Note that a workspace's active change sets are included in its change history (after the closed change sets).

        Note: Accepting baselines IWorkspaceConnection.accept(int, IWorkspaceConnection, IChangeHistorySyncReport, List, List, IProgressMonitor) may significantly re-order the change sets in recent entries. Clients should be written with this in mind.
        Parameters:
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the list of change sets (element type: IChangeHistoryEntry); the elements are in chronological order (element 0 is the least recent, with the last element being the most recent in history); no duplicates; unmodifiable and fixed; never null, although the list can be empty.
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

      • previousHistory

        IChangeHistory previousHistory(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                               throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns an object that can be used to access the earlier history. This operation fails if this change history is not available.
        Parameters:
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the previous change history, or null if this is the initial era
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

      • getHistoryDescriptor

        IChangeHistoryDescriptor getHistoryDescriptor(boolean requireStateHandles,
                                            org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                              throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns a data structure which describes the current state of history, including the list of change sets made in the era of this change history as well as a reference to the previous change history if one exists. The change sets are arranged in approximate chronological order (in terms of when they were applied to the object, such as a workspace, which has the change history, rather than by their absolute creation dates). The change sets are intended to be applied in that order to the configuration corresponding to the previous history. This operation fails if this change history is not available. Note: Accepting baselines IWorkspaceConnection.accept(int, IWorkspaceConnection, IChangeHistorySyncReport, List, List, IProgressMonitor) may significantly re-order the change sets in recent entries. Clients should be written with this in mind.

        Note that a workspace's active change sets are included in its change history (after the closed change sets).

        Parameters:
        requireStateHandles - true if the caller wishes to have state handles returned in the descriptor's recent era, false otherwise.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a history descriptor; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

      • getHistoryDescriptors

        java.util.List<IChangeHistoryDescriptor> getHistoryDescriptors(int numberOfChangeSets,
                                                             boolean requireStateHandles,
                                                             org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                               throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns a list of data structures describing the current state of this era and its predecessors, including enough eras to span the given number of change sets if the history is long enough.

        The descriptors are arranged in chronological order (in terms of when they were applied to the object, such as a workspace, which has the change history, rather than by their absolute creation dates). The oldest predecessor will be first and the most recent era will be last.

        Note that a workspace's active change sets are included in its change history (after the closed change sets).

        Parameters:
        numberOfChangeSets - number of change sets desired by the client. If there are enough eras in this history, the result will contain at least enough eras to span the given number of change sets. If there are not enough change sets in all eras, the entire history will be returned.
        requireStateHandles - true if the caller wishes to have state handles returned in the descriptor's recent era, false otherwise.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a history descriptor; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

      • compareChangeHistories

        IChangeHistorySyncReport compareChangeHistories(IChangeHistory remoteHistory,
                                              org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                throws TeamRepositoryException
        Compares this change history to the given remote change history and returns a report describing their relative synchronization.

        This operation fails if either this change history or the given one is unavailable for any reason. The two change histories must have the same component (see also getComponent()).

        Active change sets are included even through incoming active change sets are never eligible to be accepted.

        Parameters:
        remoteHistory - the remote change history; must not be null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a report describing the relative synchronization of this change history with the given change history; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

      • getRelatedEntries

        java.util.List getRelatedEntries(IChangeSetHandle cs,
                               org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                 throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieves the change history entries that were created at the same time as the entry for the given changeset.
        Parameters:
        cs - the changeset whose related entries to find
        Returns:
        a list of entries related to the given one (element type: IChangeHistoryEntryChange), sorted by order in the change history, oldest first. Empty list if the given changeset is not in this change history; never null
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any reason

      • getHistoryFor

        java.util.List getHistoryFor(IVersionableHandle versionableHandle,
                           int limit,
                           boolean examineEras,
                           org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                             throws TeamRepositoryException
        Deprecated. Use getHistoryFor(IVersionableHandle, int, IProgressMonitor) instead
        Given a IVersionableHandle returns a list of IChangeHistoryEntryChange entries, ordered from the most recent to the earliest change set referencing the item. It is assumed that the referenced versions can be found in the component that scopes this configuration.

        The entries will describe what has occurred to the element over time. The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if the client is not logged in to the repository. [TODO consider supporting other start/stop criteria]

        Parameters:
        versionableHandle - The versionable whose history is requested. State is not important; must not be null
        limit - The maximum number of changes to report on. Value must be >0. Use Integer.MAX_VALUEfor all changes.
        examineEras - True if earlier era's change sets are to be examined to find changes to the versionable. False if the search is to be limited to only the recent change sets.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a possibly empty list of change sets (element type: IChangeHistoryEntryChange) ordered with the most recent changes first; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

      • getHistoryFor

        java.util.List getHistoryFor(IVersionableHandle versionableHandle,
                           int limit,
                           org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                             throws TeamRepositoryException
        Given a IVersionableHandle returns a list of IChangeHistoryEntryChange entries, ordered from the most recent to the earliest change set referencing the item.

        The entries will describe what has occurred to the element over time. The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if the client is not logged in to the repository.

        Parameters:
        versionableHandle - The versionable whose history is requested. State is not important; must not be null
        limit - The maximum number of changes to report on. Value must be greater than zero. Use Integer.MAX_VALUE for all changes.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a possibly empty list of change sets (element type: IChangeHistoryEntryChange) ordered with the most recent changes first; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

      • getHistoryForFolder

        java.util.List<IChangeHistoryEntryChange> getHistoryForFolder(IFolderHandle folderHandle,
                                                            int limit,
                                                            org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                              throws TeamRepositoryException
        Given a IFolderHandle returns a list of IChangeHistoryEntryChange entries, ordered from the most recent to the earliest change set that affect any items in the subtree of that folder in the current context.
        Parameters:
        folderHandle - The folder for which the history of the folder subtree is being requested
        limit - The maximum number of changes to report on. Value must be greater than zero. Use Integer.MAX_VALUE for all changes.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a possibly empty list of change sets (element type: IChangeHistoryEntryChange) ordered with the most recent changes first; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        Since:
        0.11.0.5 (RTC 6.0.5)
